bill_title: provide a felony penalty for certain violations of petition circulation laws.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a felony penalty for certain violations of petition circulation laws. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 2-1 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: In addition to any other penalty provided under law, any person who knowingly forges or causes to be forged a signature on a petition for an initiated amendment to the Constitution, initiated measure, or referred law, or who knowingly or with reckless disregard violates any law regarding the circulation of petitions for signatures is guilty of a Class 5 felony. Section 2. That chapter 2-1 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: In addition to any other penalty provided under law, any person who swears to an affidavit as a petition sponsor under chapter 2-1 regarding a petition for an initiated amendment to the Constitution, initiated measure, or referred law, and who knowingly conspires with any other person to commit a violation of section 1 of this Act is guilty of a Class 5 felony. Section 3. That chapter 2-1 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: No person who is convicted of a violation of the provisions of section 1 or 2 of this Act, or for knowingly violating any law regarding the circulation of petitions for signatures, may be a petition sponsor or a petition circulator for a period to last ten years.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
